A4.text: The most common Danish family name surnames are patronymic and end in -sen.

A5.text: The most common surnames in Sweden are originally patronymic. Family names ending with the suffix 'sson' are the most common names in Sweden.

A6.text: Andersen is a Scandinavian patronymic surname with suffix '-sen', which is not characteristic of German surnames.

A7.text: In 2009, 22.4% of the Norwegian population had a surname with the suffix '-sen'.

A8.text: In Iceland, surnames have a gender-specific suffix (-d√≥ttir = daughter, -son = son). This was also the case in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden, until they were abolished by law in 1856, 1923, and 1966 respectively.
